attributes.action: Make child benefit rules fairer
attributes.background: Currently couples with one partner earning over 60 thousand pounds annually are not entitled to any child benefit. If however both parents are working and they earn over 60 thousand pounds combined but with both individully earning less than that amount, they are entitled to this benefit.
attributes.additional_details: A couple may earn 55 thousand pounds each and get child benefit however if one person earns 60 thousand they do not.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for landlords todiscriminate against families with children.
attributes.background: Landlords should not be able to refuse to rent their propert to people based on whether they have children or not unless there is a safety issue. Many do not refuse on this basis and even stipulate criteria like 'one child only.' This practice should not be allowed to continue.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park on or in front of a dropped kerb and private driveways.
attributes.background: Current high way code rules recommend that people do not block private driveways. As this is not an illegal action, people suffer the consequences of irresponsible parking by others. The move to make this action illegal and therefore give the police power to discourage problems.

attributes.action: Bring in a law to stop any more buildings over 30 floors being built in London.
attributes.background: London isn't Manhattan. Our original environment is dwarfed by mega-towers that no-one lives in. Let's ask the Government to bring in planning law to prevent any more towers over 30 floors being built in Central London. Those extra floors aren't solving any housing crisis - just overseas investors
attributes.additional_details:
Guardian article on 50 story St George's Wharf tower - the blight of Vauxhall riverside: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/24/revealed-foreign-buyers-own-two-thirds-of-tower-st-george-wharf-london
This Ipsos mori survey for Skyline Campaign suggests that lots of people agree with me: 
http://workplaceinsight.net/majority-of-londoners-support-greater-restrictions-on-new-tall-buildings/

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory driving licence re-testing for old age pensioners
attributes.background:
It has been shown numerous times that old age causes lowered reflexes and reaction times. This has been reflected in the high level of accidents and poor driving from pensioners.

To maintain the standards of driving on UK roads, I propose mandatory re-testing above a certain age (perhaps ~70).
attributes.additional_details:
Here's is the most recent example of many: 

"Eight car pile-up after elderly driver goes wrong way down motorway"

http://metro.co.uk/2016/08/31/eight-car-pile-up-after-elderly-driver-goes-wrong-way-down-motorway-6101485/#ixzz4IzPn56B6

Studies suggest that older drivers are no more dangerous than young drivers, but it is scientifically certain that old age results in degradation of the senses. As such, it stands to reason that there is a point when driving is no longer a safe endeavour.

attributes.action: Restrict drivers aged 17-22 to cars limited to 40mph and 0-60mph 15 secs
attributes.background: It is common to see young drivers driving badly, too fast, aggressively,  and involved in accidents that cause death and injury to themselves and others. I believe it would be a relatively easy step to restrict the power and speed of cars driven by young drivers.
attributes.additional_details: It would require car manufacturers to create a new range of restricted, but affordable cars, that would also lead to cheaper insurance for first time drivers.

attributes.action: Legal limit for clearance of the accidents and road re opening under 2 hours.
attributes.background:
23/08/2016 M27 closed FOR 6 HOURS! at Junction Two for Salisbury after caravan overturns on A31 near Cadnam. 
Excessive amount of work, Excessive shut down, Dangerous situation for public and the Nature on Diverted routs.
attributes.additional_details:
Road maintenance looks increasingly like a gravy train! Inefficiency is really spectacular ! They obviously sacrificed efficiency to illusion of safety. The question, how many accidents has happened on diverted routs? How many social and economic consequences from that careless inaction? How bad an congestion impact on nature? 
And it is everywhere, not only accidents. Why to limit 20 Ml of M3 from Heathrow to Fleet? We hear lots of words about infrastructure so far, but no action!

attributes.action: Offer teachers salary sacrifice car scheme
attributes.background: Sources continue to raise awareness of the teacher shortage crisis. Even though there are initiatives to recruit new teachers, more needs to be done to retain the best teachers by offering incentives such as a car salary sacrifice schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationopinion/12182027/How-to-solve-the-teacher-recruitment-crisis.html

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2016/jul/26/secondary-schools-spent-56m-teacher-job-ads-labour

http://www.fleetnews.co.uk/news/fleet-industry-news/2015/06/01/government-to-consider-salary-sacrifice-car-schemes-for-teachers

attributes.action: Stop Sexual Harrassment in Schools
attributes.background:
A 2010 YouGov poll of 16-18 year olds found 29% of girls experienced unwanted sexual touching at school and a further 71% said they heard sexual name-calling towards girls at school daily or a few times per week.
We want it to be made law for schools to train teachers on how to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
Data published in September 2015 showed that 5,500 sexual offences were recorded in UK schools over a three year period, including 600 rapes. 
In 2015 Girlguiding UK found 90% of young women aged 13-21 agree that the government should make sure all schools are addressing sexual harassment and bullying in schools.

attributes.action: Increase funds and awareness of homeless shelters for young people on our street
attributes.background: Homeless Youth are far too often stereotyped as dangerous troublemakers. Change is needed, as homeless youth need to be noticed. We need to provide food, water and shelter. We need your help to raise awareness, and end homelessness in Youth for good. Help our cause. #itcouldbeme.
attributes.additional_details:
We are part of the Jackman Team, National Citizen Service (NCS) The Challenge, Wave 11, Croydon. Over the past week we have planned a campaign to help homeless Youth in our area on Friday 26th August 2016 in Croydon town centre.
Abuse, money loss, family bereavement are all causes of our new generation becoming homeless. Do we really want the future to be on our streets? Help our cause. Sign our petition. Together, we can end Youth homelessness for good.

attributes.action: Get British troops out of Iraq and Syria and stop all air strikes now
attributes.background: The presence of British troops in Syria and Iraq and the bombing and killing of innocent people including children is beyond wrong this war that's already been shown to be fake, no weapons of mass destruction were ever found so why does it carry on?!
attributes.additional_details: The fight to have Tony Blair held accountable for his actions over the war in Iraq speaks for itself and you only need to watch the news and see poor babies and children being pulled from rubble that was once their local hospital, library, school or home. So many leave their homes and don't ever return it's so wrong and we shouldn't stand by and let it happen any longer, the world will be one by peace love and cooperation not hate fighting and war. We can stop it together

attributes.action: Give prisoners the right to vote
attributes.background: The European Court of Human Rights has told the UK it is violating a human right by not allowing prisoners to vote.The Government is choosing to ignore this, however this is preventing a true democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://fullfact.org/law/votes-prisoners-politics-versus-human-rights-law/

attributes.action: Close legal loophole allowing NHS Price cap rules to be bypassed. Criminalise it
attributes.background: Several unscrupulous companies have made millions by legally bypassing the NHS price cap rules, by dropping the brand names of medicines and giving them their generic name.  This has caused astronomical price hikes, and patients are being refused their medicines because the NHS cannot afford them.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3623324/Millionaire-firms-forcing-price-common-NHS-drugs-262MILLION-year-exploiting-branding-loophole.html

attributes.action: Allow alternative advanced chemotherapy treatment in the UK
attributes.background: We have a very close friend who is terminally ill with cancer. Our dear friend Brigitta, who is a mother of 2 children, Marco and Denym and loving wife to Massi has fought this dreadful disease for 13 years and endured various forms of treatment. She is now in need of advanced specialist treatment
attributes.additional_details:
To enable Brigitta to live her life and feel slightly more normal again, we are having to raise £30,000 to send her overseas for specialist medical treatment which could really make a difference to her health and current situation. 
If this was to be available in the UK to Brigitta, then her family would not have the concerns they do about funds and could have this advanced treatment without having to rely so much on other peoples help. 
We are currently organising events and fundraising pages to help Brigitta through her journey, and hope we reach this goal to get her this treatment that she deserves.
Please help and support this worthy cause, and get this treatment into the UK!

attributes.action: Establish a National Burkini Day.
attributes.background: Swimming at beaches, in public or private pools is everyone's right.  Those who chose to do so in a Burkini should be encouraged to participate in such recreation.  Establishment of National Burkini Day would be in the best traditions of our great country.  Please support this petition.

attributes.action: Stop cutting child benefits for families struggling in the uk
attributes.background: From April 2016 the income threshold was cut from £6,420 to £3,850 meaning fewer people are eligible to claim child benefits, for families with over two children in the UK this means that they will not get benefits for the 3rd+ child.

attributes.action: Change the upgrading process for motorcycle licenses.
attributes.background:
On 19th January 2013 the motorcycle licence restrictions changed for new motorcycle riders. 

This meant that in order to upgrade from an A2 motorcycle license to an A motorcycle license requires the rider to pass the exact same test that they passed two years prior on an arbitrarily smaller bike.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst the tiered licensing system has its merits, and rightfully deserves to stay, a rethink on the upgrading process for riders must be considered.

If the automatic upgrade that was in place before the 2013 update is not satisfactory, perhaps some type of competency test on a larger motorcycle could be implemented, to ensure the rider's skills are still satisfactory - an advanced version of the CBT for riders with existing qualifications who wish to advance through their licenses.

attributes.action: Stop the minting of Copper Coins
attributes.background: There is very little that can be purchsed for 1p or 2p now, so it is pointless having these coins. It is also a waste of money minting them. If the lowest denomination of coin minted was 5p then everything could be priced at £x.95 instead of £x.99
attributes.additional_details:
New Zealand's smallest coin is the 10c which is approximately equivalent to 5p (GBP)
Australia has scrapped its 1c & 2c and its 5c coin is approximately equivalent to 3p (GBP)
In the USA it has long been known that minting the 1c coin actually costs more than 1c per coin.
Many people in the UK often throw away 1p & 2p coins as they are practically worthless.

attributes.action: Put The Open Golf Championship back on free to air TV
attributes.background: This is the first time in 60 years The Open as not been broadcast on free to air TV. Signing the petition will help influence the government to make The Open Championship a group A protected listed sporting event. Live coverage of the event will then be offered to free to air broadcasters.
attributes.additional_details: The Open Championship dates back to 1860 and is the the world's most prestigious golf tournament and one of four golf majors. With the an international field of the world's best golfers competing for the top prize in golf. The coverage of The Open as been enjoyed by millions on the BBC for the last 60 years, inspiring viewers of all ages to go out and play golf. As a nation we should be proud to host this event and it should be celebrated as one of the great British sporting events.

attributes.action: Always send users of Class A substances such as heroin to rehab, not jail
attributes.background: Due to the horrific nature of addiction when it comes to substances such as Heroin and Crack cocaine I believe we should be giving users as much help as possible. These people need treatment, not punishment. Making it harder for them to get a job is also less likely to get them off these substances.

attributes.action: Make discrimination of tattoos/piercings in the workplace a criminal offence
attributes.background: People shouldn't be discriminated against for their tattoos or piercings because it doesn't affect your quality/quantity of work. It's the same as discriminating against someone for their hair/eye/skin colour.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are discriminated against for their tattoos/piercings and a lot of people are rejected jobs because of them. body art doesn't affect the way someone works or how much someone works. so why are tattoos and piercings such a problem in the workplace?

attributes.action: Harsher punishments for people who discriminate.
attributes.background: Hate crime is on the rise. There was 4,345 cases of homophobic hate crime in 2011/12 and there was 5,597 cases in 2014/15. These criminals only get a fine or a short prison sentence for their crimes, this has to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: I know myself what it is like to be discriminated and disrespected, its an awful feeling and makes you question yourself and your existence.

attributes.action: Stop all DWP benefit payment sanctions immediately.
attributes.background:
It is basically unethical and unhealthy.
The UN agree - It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in B
attributes.additional_details:
THE United Nations committee on economic and cultural rights recently published a highly damning report.
It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in Britain.
The report considers a number of areas, all of which are drastically important to our everyday lives. . . . 
 foodbanks, unemployment rates, the housing crisis, mental health care and discrimination against migrants and disabled people.

attributes.action: Reverse the agreement for the MOD to purchse helicopters from the USA
attributes.background: The UK helicopter manufacturers have a fantastic track record and in the present economic uncertainty of the UK it would be wrong to award the new fleet to US manufacturers.  The UK has proved over many many years that they could fulfil the MODs requirements.

attributes.action: Completely Scrap Stamp Duty, we pay enough taxes!
attributes.background: Stamp Duty should be scraped, we pay enough already in taxes and scraping Stamp Duty will help people to afford to buy a property

attributes.action: Terrorism: victim family members to be invited on independent commission.
attributes.background: When acts of terrorism occur, victim family members should be given the opportunity to be part of an independent commission (funded by the UK government), to ensure there is a full & proper investigation into the death of their loved ones.

attributes.action: Get NHS backing for MAP vaccine for Crohn's disease and colitis cure
attributes.background: I am a Crohn's disease and colitis sufferer. Life is very difficult because there is no cure. There is a possible cure at the Kings college hospital. The trials cannot go ahead because there is not enough funding. Meanwhile IBD sufferers have to struggle with life. This vaccine could help cure IBD
attributes.additional_details: There are 250,000 people in the UK that suffer from IBD, over 80% need to have surgery to correct or remove the colon. It is a chronic disease which is debilitating. Prof. John. Hermon - Taylor has worked out that a bacteria found in cattle is transferred to humans with a weak immune system. I have to have lots of medication to get through each day and have been hospitalised because I cannot get a remission. Crohn's and colitis sufferers are desperate for a cure. The vaccine is ready to test

attributes.action: Pursue a tariff free trade deal and free movement of people deal with the USA
attributes.background: We have been allies for a long time and we would highly complement each other to be able to trade and move freely for purposes of work and or family reuniting purposes, students should still be under student visas however!
attributes.additional_details: My own example is my wife and I married over in the USA 15/04/2011 due to unrealistic income requirement have been apart for 5 years of our marriage we have had just 9 months together 3 in USA and 6 in the UK, she has vast experience in care and in hotel management and retail so could get a job here, I am easily able to gain work there as a PSV driver and HGV and or in gaining EMT state certification there to gain employment! Both of us would have to file taxes in our own countries even if zero!

attributes.action: Abolish university fees: we should be entitled to free education.
attributes.background: Fees for attending university in England have rocketed. Now the government has announced that student maintenance grants will be replaced with loans in 2016, meaning that students could end up in up to £50,000 in debt.

attributes.action: Call a General Election once the new Conservative leader has been selected.
attributes.background: The EU referendum result has left the current government with no backup plan. This petition therefore asks for a General Election to be called so that the parties can set out their positions with regard to EU negotiations. The new government can then go forward with a new mandate and clear plans.
attributes.additional_details: For better or worse, if the UK leaves the EU, we will be entering an unfamiliar economic and diplomatic landscape. A General Election would give the nation an opportunity to debate the implications of the vote and our place in the world. It may not be legally required but, given the vast implications of the referendum result, a General Election is surely a moral and democratic necessity. The future direction of the whole country should not be decided by the members of any single political party.

attributes.action: A public enquiry to review why people voted as they did in the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
It too easy for politicians just to say referendum complete, democracy has been served. Public opinion must be present throughout the whole process, to ensure we receive a democratic outcome. 

This is a massive decision in the country's history we should find out the facts before we progress.
attributes.additional_details:
UK decision makers must be armed with infomation which details the reasons why the UK electorate voted as they did. Enabling these decision makers to formulate the next steps in a way which is in line with public opinion.

Lies have been told on both sides.

People seem to have been unaware of possible economic consequences.

Decisions have been revaluated.

Votes may have been cast as a protest against the UK government.

attributes.action: Make unsecured debt remedies available for child support arrears.
attributes.background: According to Gingerbread, the CSA has left almost £4bn of outstanding arrears, with the DWP’s estimating only £467m is ever likely to be recovered.
attributes.additional_details: According to Gingerbread's latest report, www.gingerbread.org.uk/content/2297/Missing-maintenance nearly half of single-parent families live below the poverty line and the number is increasing. Although the CMS charges for collection, it has only recovered 53% due (leaving£52.5m arrears) and less than half the eligible children getting anything. Its collection remedies are insufficient, particularly for the large number of self-employed/cash- in- hand owing parents.

attributes.action: Set the voting age for referendums to 16
attributes.background:
Referendums cover issues with a long term effect. 

Very often a 16 year old at voting time will be 18 when the decision comes into force
attributes.additional_details:
In Scotland the voting age for many elections is already 16.

It is not logical to deprive these people of the vote for referendums.

A next step should be to make the voting age for referendums 16 throughout the UK

attributes.action: Give the 28% of people who did not vote in the UK EU referendum a chance to vote
attributes.background: In the referendum only 72% of people voted for what to happen to the country, we believe that these people who might not have understood the circumstances should have the right to vote now. We are not asking for another referendum but for a continuation of the previous vote, for the 28% undecided.
attributes.additional_details: The votes should be added on to the original totals and interpreted in the decision of whether to leave or stay in the European Union for the sake of the people of the United kingdom. We think this because the more information has been released after the original vote had taken place, and this information could alter the opinions of the undecided UK residents.

attributes.action: Make swimming lessons in Secondary Schools optional
attributes.background: Pupils in Secondary schools are being forced to take part in swimming lessons, being told it 'isn't optional', despite most children being taught how to swim in Primary school. Adolescents should be given the choice whether they want to swim or not, as some are not comfortable doing so.
attributes.additional_details: Older children are being forced to wear swimming costumes and swim in a group with their peers, which can often cause distress, particularly to adolescents having their period who may be forced to wear tampons, or those not comfortable with wearing such clothing in front of others.

attributes.action: We would like to propose that May 1st be officially recognised as Union Day.
attributes.background: On the 1st May 1707 Parliament officially recognised the union of Great Britain
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acts_of_Union_1707

attributes.action: Referendum on the Danish option for UK devolved regions to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
Mainland Denmark is in the EU, whilst devolved Greenland and Faroe Islands are in Danemark but not in the EU.

We request that the regions that voted RemaIN, should  remain part of the EU, and the regions that voted leave, to be outside the EU, without breaking up the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
We hereby call on the elected representatives of all the areas that voted RemaIN to negotiate with the EU to enable our clearly expressed wishes to remain EU citizens, and to press the UK government to explore all possible options in our relationship with the EU.

We request that the UK government hold a new referendum on all realistic possible options for the relationship between the UK and the EU, before the UK government starts the formal process for the UK to leave the EU.

attributes.action: Re-Nationalise British Steel Industry following Brexit.
attributes.background: It appears unlikely a private buyer will be found following Brexit and we cannot afford to lose these skills, jobs or rely on overseas mills to supply our steel.

attributes.action: Give the right to children to argue their case in schools
attributes.background: In schools, teachers have complete over-riding control over what children say. If they are falsely accused of doing something which they believe they have not done, or they do not believe they do not deserve a certain punishment, it is labelled as "talking back."
attributes.additional_details: This is a petition to allow children to be able to freely argue their case with a neutral member of staff present in order to make sure that they receive a fair sanction. I have witnessed cases of children not being listened to and having to email the teacher to be heard. Sign for your child's rights.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK's policy on the EU with options for different plans.
attributes.background:
A referendum not grouping policies on what we should do about the EU so the decision isn't made without asking the people.

Suggested options -

Remain in the EU
Leave but remain in the EEA
Leave the EU & EEA, keeping trade agreements 
Leave all EU agreements
attributes.additional_details:
After the July referendum MPs are now discussing what we should do and when we should do it. 

This is because the options weren't clear enough and it is in the interests of democracy to ask the population how they want to deal with Europe with regards to the key issues of membership, economy, trade and immigration.

In short, as we currently have no public consensus on a plan, we are currently set to have a new Prime Minister elected only by Tory Party members choose what we do.

attributes.action: To have the 23rd June declared an official day of mourning.
attributes.background: To demonstrate to the people who voted us out of the European Union, that we do not consider the 23rd June a cause for celebration.
attributes.additional_details: To be taken out of the European Union is an extremely serious step with catastrophic consequences and there are at least 16 million people who agree with me.  We are not going to be forced to make this move without some form of protest at the least.

attributes.action: Parliamentary inquiry into deceitful claims to sway an election or referendum
attributes.background: The Brexit campaign dishonestly pledged £350 million per week for the NHS in full knowledge that this was was an impossibility.  This is just one example of a growing trend in British politics.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a growing tendency for candidates to field statements that they know to be wrong merely to gain a vote for their party or themselves.  Integrity is being eroded together with the high standards that once reflected British politics and decisions.  Can a successful vote won on the basis of deceit be democratically or morally valid?
I believe that it is time to openly discuss this problem through the proper vehicle of a parliamentary enquiry into such practices.

attributes.action: To form a UK sterling trade area
attributes.background:
The formation of a sterling trade area comprising England and Wales, an independent Scotland and a united Ireland has the 
 potential to resolve almost all issues of sovereignty, currency, trade agreements following the Brexit decision

attributes.action: Block all suspected and convicted terrorists and murderers from entering the UK
attributes.background: Block all suspected and convicted terrorists and murderers from entering the UK, regardless of nationality.

attributes.action: HM Government to initiate talks to allow Scotland to remain in the E.U.
attributes.background: Greenland exited the E.U. (E.E.C) in 1985, while Denmark remained within the EU. On that basis, as it's the will of the Scottish people (via the Referendum of 23/06/16) to remain within the E.U,  both Holyrood and Westminster to discuss arrangements that will Scotland alone to remain in the E.U.
attributes.additional_details: Reference to the UK referendum of 23/06/16 confirms it is the will of the Scottish people to remain within the European Union. Scotland does not agree with England and Wales and is being dragged, against its sovereign will out of the European Union.

attributes.action: Open The United Kingdom's borders for free trade with everyone in the world.
attributes.background: Further to the EU Referendum which voted for The United Kingdom to leave the European Union, I propose that we open our borders for the free movement of goods to and from anywhere in the world.

attributes.action: All political parties to have equal say in negotiating terms of exit from the EU
attributes.background: The future of Britain after the Referendum is the single most important issue facing us today. Our prosperity, security and well-being, as well as that of the rest of Europe and beyond is too big a responsibility for one group of politicians and cannot be left solely to the current government.
attributes.additional_details: We are told that exit negotiations could take up to two years. Mr Cameron says it should be left until his successor is appointed after October 2016. This could mean that the earliest date for implementation would be October 2018; only 15 months before the next general election which may provide a change of government. Therefore the crucial first years after implementation should involve all parties.

attributes.action: British People who are EU nationals should allowed to vote for Parl. Elections.
attributes.background: All British People should be given an opportunity to vote and stand for parliamentary Elections, just as 53 Commonwealth citizens and Irish Nationals domicile in the UK can. Should a 2nd EU Referendum be invoked all the 27 EU Citizens domicile in the UK should be allowed to vote like Irish nationals
attributes.additional_details:
The rules for the Irish were framed during the last century.
All EU nationals resident in Great Britain can vote for all other elections in the UK.
These EU nationals resident in the UK were not given a right to vote even though they pay taxes. Some of them for decades.

attributes.action: Deputy Prime minister post alongside Primeminister & one of them must be a woman
attributes.background: According to 2011 census the UK population was estimated 31 million men and 32.2 million women. By a women in such a key post by law will bring equality and fairness in politics and businesses - women think, work and decide differently - having women's contribution will enhance government polices.
attributes.additional_details: Out of 650 MPs there are 191 women although their representation is improving, they are still often a long way from getting to the highest posts. Studies at Stanford US and University of Chicago have found that districts served by female legislators are at a distinct advantage over those represented by men. Women are actually more inclined towards more modern leadership, which is collaborative problem-solving, enabling, consultative, and not just trying to assert a kind of hierarchical power.

attributes.action: Set up a unity commission to negotiate the terms of Brexit.
attributes.background: Exceptional circumstances require an exceptional response. HM Government should set aside narrow party politics and set up a commission with the power to negotiate the terms of our exit. This must include representatives of all parties, all regions, all backgrounds, and many interest groups.
attributes.additional_details: The terms of Brexit are too important to leave to the interests of a narrow political group. A commission should be set up with the power to negotiate our exit. This would allow the nation to draw together politicians from all parties who polled more than 5% at the last general election. Members should also be appointed from business, education, unions, the law, charities, public services, security and the economy. The negotiated terms will be legally binding on the government of the day.
